credentials: PHD 2022 Univ of California Los Angeles
name: Joao Moreira

ratings.comment: It was his first semester, so I'll cut him a little slack. The lectures were long and pretty boring, but attendance wasn't mandatory. All in all, what bothered me the most was how condescending he came off as. I was also in the honors discussion section with him and if you ever said something he didn't agree with he kind of just dismissed you.

Prof Moreira isn't trying to trip you up. He was a new prof this semester so I'd cut him some slack. Make sure to be on top of your Canvas quizzes bc those can make or break ur grade. I'd recommend going to office hours to ask any clarifying ?s for exams/essays. If you have a specific situation or hardship in the class def talk to him in person.

Would recommend; the content was interesting, and Dr. Moreira is clearly enthusiastic and knowledgeable, which made lectures worthwhile. The vibe during lecture definitely became less sterile and more personable as the semester progressed, so I would expect more of the latter going forward. 

Take a shot for every film reference during lecture :,)

Joao is a new prof, so his class has unclear grading criteria, exam questions with awful wording, and strangely paced lectures. Honestly I didn't learn anything useful from his class, and spent most of lecture time bored out of my mind. Joao comes off as both condescending and also unsure of himself which isn't the best combo.

Provides study guides for exams and comprehension quizzes weekly. Written assignments are graded hard even if you follow rubric. Most information comes of lecture slides which are provided but sometimes will say random facts that you must write down because they will be on the test. Extra credit is helpful if you are on the cusp.
